conclusion: Analyze the P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle to determine changes in the rate distribution curve from state D to state A.
The image shows a P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle with states A, B, C, and D. Transitions A→B and C→D are isothermal. D→A forms a loop.
The Stirling cycle involves four processes: isothermal compression (A→B), constant volume (B→C), isothermal expansion (C→D), and constant volume (D→A).
Since A→B and C→D are isothermal, the temperature remains constant, so the rate distribution curve does not change.
During D→A, a constant volume process, the rate distribution curve does not change assuming no external factors.
The rate distribution curve of the gas molecule does not change during the transition from state D to state A.
